posts.cooked:
I am on a number of quite large groups. The largest now, 601 members. In the past, I noticed that a number of the people listed in these groups came up as “Unknown contact”. I had thought these were people who had left Signal, but that ended up no being the case, as we found out to howls of complaints when starting to remove such "Unknown"s. I brought some of this up on the github tracker, and things changed a bit. We still have a large number of "Unknown"s; but in addition, some members of groups who have names, when I try to text them, appear as “This Person Isn’t Using Signal”.

  1. What are the “Unknowns”
  2. If a person who is listed as “Isn’t Using Signal” re-installs Signal, are they automatically returned to having membership in the group?

I’m trying to figure out who can be removed, and who not.
Not sure about your first question, but your second one: I believe they get added back in the group once they install Signal again, unless being removed.
I’ve been told that in fact happens, but it’s clearly a security issue. Someone else could now have the phone number, and so a stranger could end up a the group!

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Then remove them from the group if the account is inactive or the safety number changes.

There is no indication that an account is inactive, other than going into the group members, clicking on each, seeing if they are still registered with signal, then returning to the contacts list, then to the group, then to the group members, and checking the next one. This is just not viable beyond maybe 3 people.

I think if someone is no longer registered, then re-installs, they should need to re-request entry to a group.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: If you send a message in the group, deleted accounts will show up under skipped in message details.

That’s different from “Isn’t Using Signal”. I have people on groups who, when I check the info for a message, it says “Sent to” but doesn’t convert to “Delivered to”. Nevertheless, when I check the thread with them individually, it doesn’t say “Isn’t Using Signal”.

How is any of this going to help a large group figure out who has left Signal and who might return having acquired a number from an ex-member? I’m also still totally unclear who the "unknown"s are.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It’s exactly what I told you. Accounts that have been deleted will show up as skipped under message details. I said skipped; not sent to, or delivered status’s. It’s a different status message entirely to those two.
They do not. I have checked. Accounts that show up as “Isn’t Using Signal” when I look in the individual thread, are showing up as “Sent to” but never convert to “Delivered to”.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Ah, it’s not available on Desktop AFAIK. You’d need to check on your primary device.
It’s not possible to manage 600 group members on a phone.

Ok, so regarding someone like this:

“I have a second Signal account on a device that I haven’t signed in [she means, turned on the phone and connected to the internet] to for several weeks. Lots of people are in this situation, when they have a problem with the phone or iPad or computer. Signal is showing me as not being a Signal user [she means “Isn’t Using Signal” appears in a thread with her]. That is not correct. It’s just that I haven’t logged in for a while.”

When they turn back on their phone, they’ll at minimum have to update Signal. If updating, the keys will be preserved, so remaining on the group will not be an issue.

If they have to reinstall, or if they move to another phone while keeping their old phone number, and therefore having to install Signal anew, what happens under the conditions that:

  1. they have their PIN? Are the keys retained?

  2. they do not have their PIN? I assume they get new keys?

In the case of keys being retained, there’s no issue rejoining the group. If the keys are not retained, are they still allowed to re-join the group, just based on the phone number? Is this when it says on the group, “Safety Number has Changed”?
It is, just takes some more time and patience. :-)

This is just diverting the thread. Please let’s get back to the point:

  1. What is “Unknown”

  2. Under what conditions is a person listed as “Isn’t Using Signal” returned to membership in a group? See the post above that says:

regarding someone like this:

“I have a second Signal account on a device that I haven’t signed in [she means, turned on the phone and connected to the internet] to for several weeks. Lots of people are in this situation, when they have a problem with the phone or iPad or computer. Signal is showing me as not being a Signal user [she means “Isn’t Using Signal” appears in a thread with her]. That is not correct. It’s just that I haven’t logged in for a while.”

When they turn back on their phone, they’ll at minimum have to update Signal. If updating, the keys will be preserved, so remaining on the group will not be an issue.

If they have to reinstall, or if they move to another phone while keeping their old phone number, and therefore having to install Signal anew, what happens under the conditions that:

they have their PIN? Are the keys retained?

they do not have their PIN? I assume they get new keys?

In the case of keys being retained, there’s no issue rejoining the group. If the keys are not retained, are they still allowed to re-join the group, just based on the phone number? Is this when it says on the group, “Safety Number has Changed”?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Diagon:

That is not correct. It’s just that I haven’t logged in for a while.”

After a certain period of time with no account activity, Signal accounts are automatically deleted, so it would be accurate to say they aren’t using Signal, since the account no longer exists. I believe this time period is 90 days.

Diagon:

If they have to reinstall, or if they move to another phone while keeping their old phone number, and therefore having to install Signal anew, what happens under the conditions that:

  1. they have their PIN? Are the keys retained?
  2. they do not have their PIN? I assume they get new keys?
  1. Keys are retained if the account has not been deleted (90 days). If the account has been deleted, no keys will be retained and a new Safety Number will be generated. If they reinstall on a new device without transfering from their old device via Signal’s built in tools, they will generate a new Safety Number.
  2. Yes for every situation.
Diagon:

In the case of keys being retained, there’s no issue rejoining the group. If the keys are not retained, are they still allowed to re-join the group, just based on the phone number? Is this when it says on the group, “Safety Number has Changed”?

Internally, Signal does not use phone numbers or usernames for message exchanges. Instead, Signal uses randomly generated ACI’s (random string of fixed length, also named Account Identifier). These ACI’s are assigned to a specific number and is what is used by other Signal clients to exchange messages, manage who they’re talking to, adding them to groups, etc.

In no case is a phone number used for group membership, but usually, a given number is assigned a specific ACI for a given period of time. It is reused if you re-register Signal within 120 days I believe. This is a tradeoff for convenience since a user re-registering within this time period would typically not be a new owner of the number (not that I agree with this approach, just how it is).

image1669×1112 111 KB

Group membership is based on a group record. When you add someone to a group, their ACI will be added to the group record table, and you will send them a message with the Group Master Key and a resource link to the group record on the servers so they can decrypt the record.

If you have not verified the Safety Number of a user, when their Safety Number changes and you continue messaging in the group after receiving the alert instead of removing the user, your Signal client will attempt to send the user a message from this group chat, updating them once again with the Group Master Key and once again informing them they are in the group. The user with the new Safety Numeber, if on a clean re-registration with no PIN or restoration receives this message, they will get a message request asking them if they want to join the group.

Alright, I feel like I’m getting somewhere now, thanks.

signal account deleted in 90 days (check the time)

on account deletion, keys are wiped. so update or re-installation generates new keys

ACI’s are associated with a phone#. Reregistration of a phone# preserves the ACI for 120 days (check the time)

This seems clear. So, bottom line appears to be that:

  1. For 90 days, an update, reinstall with PIN, or transfer to new phone with PIN, will leave group members in their groups, and there will be no alert in the group regarding safety number change.

  2. In the 90 to 120 day range, even reinstall or transfer to new phone without the PIN will leave a given phone# in a group, though the group will get an alert regarding safety number change.

  3. After 120 days, regardless of reregistration, a person will no longer be in their groups.

Am I understanding correctly? If so, I have 2 questions:

  1. Am I right to understand that:
    “Delivered” refers to someone registered and receiving messages,
    “Sent” refers to someone registered (if that’s the right term for being in that 90 day period) that has not connected since the message.
    “Not Sent” does this refer to someone in the 90 to 120 day range, during which the ACI exists, but the person is no longer registered?

  2. I have never seen any group member automatically removed from a Signal group, even after long absence. If their ACI is retired, is there any way to identify a group member in such a state?
    Would it be a sensible request to make of the devs that they be automatically removed from a group?

  3. Wouldn’t it be sensible for the safety number and the ACI to be retired at the same time, rather than 30 days apart? Would this be a sensible request to make of the devs?
